title: Apple OS X WindowServer _XSetPreferencesForWorkspaces Type Confusion Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows local attackers to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable installations of Apple OS X. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system in order to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the CoreGraphics module. The issue lies in the failure to properly validate user-supplied data which can result in a type confusion condition. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to escalate privileges under the context of WindowServer.
addtionnal_details: Apple has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT207170
timeline:
2016-06-14 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2016-11-15 - Coordinated public release of advisory
